plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: A tall annual plant with large, bright yellow flower heads that track the sun. It is widely cultivated for its seeds and oil.
plants.location: Temperate regions of North America, cultivated worldwide
plants.funFact: Sunflowers exhibit heliotropism, turning their heads to follow the sun during the day, maximizing photosynthesis.

plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: This perennial plant features tall spikes densely packed with vibrant flowers, commonly blue, purple, or pink. It thrives in meadows and open woodlands.
plants.location: Western North America, cultivated in temperate gardens
plants.funFact: Lupines enrich soil nitrogen by hosting nitrogen-fixing bacteria in their root nodules.

plants.name: Hibiscus rosa-sinensis
plants.description: A tropical shrub famous for its large, showy flowers that come in many colors. It blooms throughout warm seasons and is often grown as an ornamental plant.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical climates, peaks in summer
plants.funFact: Hibiscus flowers are edible and used to make herbal teas known for their tart flavor.

plants.name: Alcea rosea
plants.description: A biennial or short-lived perennial with tall spikes covered in large, cup-shaped flowers. Commonly found in cottage gardens and along fences.
plants.location: Native to Asia and Europe, widely cultivated
plants.funFact: Hollyhock flowers attract pollinators like bees and hummingbirds, promoting garden biodiversity.
